name: Chef Gordon Ramsay
details: Gordon James Ramsay OBE , born 8 November 1966  is a British celebrity chef, restaurateur, television personality and writer. His restaurant group, Gordon Ramsay Restaurants, was founded in 1997 and has been awarded 17 Michelin stars overall; it currently holds a total of seven. His signature restaurant, Restaurant Gordon Ramsay in Chelsea, London, has held three Michelin stars since 2001. After rising to fame on the British television miniseries Boiling Point in 1999, Ramsay became one of the best-known and most influential chefs in the world, Ramsay's television appearances are defined by his bluntness, fiery temper, strict demeanour, and the frequent use of profanity while making blunt, critical, and controversial comments, including insults and sardonic wisecracks about contestants and their cooking abilities. He combines activities in the television, film, hospitality, and food industries, and has promoted and hired various chefs who have apprenticed under his wing. He is known for presenting television programmes about competitive cookery and food.

recipe1.ingredients: 2 lb beef tenderloin, 1 lb puff pastry, 1/2 lb mushrooms, 1/4 cup Dijon mustard, 2 egg yolks, Salt and pepper, Olive oil
recipe1.cooking_method: To prepare the dish, start by searing the beef fillet in a hot pan until browned on all sides. Then, remove it from the heat and let it cool. In the same pan, sauté the mushrooms and onions until soft, then add the liver pâté and mustard and stir until combined. Roll out the puff pastry and place the beef fillet on top. Spread the mushroom mixture over the beef and wrap the puff pastry around it, tucking in the ends. Brush the pastry with egg yolks and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 30-40 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown.

recipe2.ingredients: 225g pitted dates, 175ml boiling water, 1 tsp bicarbonate of soda, 75g unsalted butter, 175g soft light brown sugar, 2 large eggs, 175g self-raising flour, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 300ml double cream, 50g caster sugar
recipe2.cooking_method: To prepare the dish, start by preheating your oven to 180°C. Place the dates in a bowl and pour over the boiling water, then add the bicarbonate of soda and let it sit for 10 minutes. In a separate bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar, then add the eggs one at a time, mixing well between each addition. Sift in the flour and mix until well combined, then fold in the date mixture and vanilla extract. Pour the batter into a greased baking dish and bake in the oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a skewer comes out clean. For the toffee sauce, heat the cream and caster sugar in a saucepan until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Serve the pudding with the warm toffee sauce poured over the top.

recipe3.ingredients: 12 large sea scallops, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 garlic clove, minced, Salt and pepper to taste, 1 lemon, cut into wedges
recipe3.cooking_method: To prepare the dish, start by patting the scallops dry with paper towels and seasoning them with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat until hot, then add the scallops and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Add the butter and garlic to the pan and stir until the butter has melted and the garlic is fragrant. Spoon the butter mixture over the scallops and serve with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Chef Emeril Lagasse
details: Emeril John Lagassé III (/ˈɛmərəl ləˈɡɑːsi/ EM-ə-rəl lə-GAH-see; born October 15, 1959)[1] is an American celebrity chef, restaurateur, television personality, cookbook author, and National Best Recipe award winner for his Turkey and Hot Sausage Chili recipe in 2003. He is a regional James Beard Award winner, known for his mastery of Creole and Cajun cuisine and his self-developed New New Orleans style. He is of Portuguese descent on his mother’s side, while being of French heritage through his father. Emeril John Lagasse III was born on October 15, 1959, in Fall River, Massachusetts, to a French-Canadian family from Quebec. His parents are Emeril John Lagassé, Jr. and a Portuguese mother, Hilda Medeiros. Lagasse worked in a Portuguese bakery as a teenager where he discovered his talent for cooking and subsequently enrolled in a culinary arts program at Diman Regional Vocational Technical High School, Lagasse graduated from the culinary school JWU in 1978 and became Executive Chef at the Dunfey's Hyannis Resort in 1979.[7] He was nominated as Chef of the Year in 1983.[7] ,In 1982, Lagasse succeeded Paul Prudhomme as executive chef of Commander's Palace in New Orleans under Richard Brennan, Sr.[8] He led the kitchen there for seven and a half years before leaving to open his own restaurant

recipe1.ingredients: Andouille sausage, Shrimp, Onion, Green bell pepper, Celery, Okra, Garlic, Flour, Chicken stock, Bay leaves, Cajun seasoning, Rice
recipe1.cooking_method: First, cook the sausage in a large pot until it's browned. Remove the sausage from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic, and cook until the vegetables are soft. Then, add the flour to make a roux, and cook until it's browned. Add the chicken stock, bay leaves, and Cajun seasoning, and bring the mixture to a boil. Add the shrimp, okra, and the cooked sausage, and simmer until the shrimp are cooked through. Serve with rice.

recipe2.ingredients: Chicken, Buttermilk, Flour, Salt, Black pepper, Cayenne pepper, Paprika, Garlic powder, Onion powder, Peanut oil
recipe2.cooking_method: First, marinate the chicken in buttermilk for several hours. In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder. Heat the peanut oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°F. Dredge the chicken in the flour mixture and shake off the excess. Fry the chicken in the hot oil until it's golden brown and cooked through. Serve with your favorite sides.

recipe3.ingredients: Large shrimp, Butter, Garlic, Worcestershire sauce, Lemon juice, Creole seasoning, Baguette
recipe3.cooking_method: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, and Creole seasoning, and cook until the garlic is fragrant. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they turn pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Serve the shrimp with the butter sauce and a toasted baguette.

name: Chef Alice Waters
details: Alice Louise Waters (born April 28, 1944) is an American chef, restaurateur, and author. In 1971, she opened Chez Panisse, a restaurant in Berkeley, California, famous for its role in creating the farm-to-table movement and for pioneering California cuisine.[2], Waters has authored the books Chez Panisse Cooking (with Paul Bertolli), The Art of Simple Food I and II, and 40 Years of Chez Panisse.[3] Her memoir, Coming to my Senses: The Making of a Counterculture Cook, was published in September 2017 and released in paperback in May 2018.[4]. Waters created the Chez Panisse Foundation in 1996 and the Edible Schoolyard program at the Martin Luther King Middle School in Berkeley. She is a national public policy advocate for universal access to healthy, organic foods. Her influence in the fields of organic foods and nutrition inspired Michelle Obama's White House organic vegetable garden program.During her time at Berkeley, Waters became active in the Free Speech Movement, which was sweeping across the campus

recipe1.ingredients: 2 eggplants, diced, 2 zucchinis, diced, 2 red bell peppers, diced, 2 yellow onions, diced, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 4 ripe tomatoes, diced, 1/4 cup olive oil, Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe1.cooking_method: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the eggplant and cook until it starts to brown, about 5-7 minutes. Add the zucchini, bell peppers, onions, and garlic, and cook until everything is softened, about 10-12 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 10-12 minutes, until everything is tender and the flavors have melded together. Season with salt and pepper, and serve hot or at room temperature.

recipe2.ingredients: 4 peaches, halved and pitted, 4 cups mixed salad greens, 1/2 cup crumbled goat cheese, 1/4 cup toasted almonds, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1/4 cup olive oil, Salt and pepper, to taste
recipe2.cooking_method: Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill over high heat. Brush the peach halves with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill the peaches for 2-3 minutes per side, until they're nicely charred and softened. Let them cool slightly, then slice into wedges. In a large bowl, combine the salad greens, sliced peaches, crumbled goat cheese, and toasted almonds. In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar and olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat.

recipe3.ingredients: 4 ripe tomatoes, diced, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil, 1/4 cup olive oil, Salt and pepper, to taste, 8 slices crusty bread, toasted
recipe3.cooking_method: In a medium bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, minced garlic, chopped basil, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Let the mixture sit for at least 30 minutes, to allow the flavors to meld together. When you're ready to serve, toast the bread slices until they're golden brown and crispy. Top each slice with a generous spoonful of the tomato mixture, and serve immediately.

name: Chef Bobby Flay
details: Robert William Flay (born December 10, 1964),[5][6] is an American celebrity chef, restaurateur, and reality television personality. Flay is the owner and executive chef of several restaurants and franchises, including Bobby's Burger Palace,[7] Bobby's Burgers,[8] and Amalfi.[9] He has worked with Food Network since 1995, which won him four Daytime Emmy Awards and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.Flay was born on December 10, 1964, in New York City[5] to Bill and Dorothy Barbara (McGuirk) Flay.[11][12] He was raised on the Upper East Side neighborhood of Manhattan.[13] He is a fourth generation Irish American and was raised Catholic, attending denominational schools. At age 8, Flay asked for an Easy-Bake Oven for Christmas. His father thought that a G.I. Joe would be more gender-appropriate. Despite his father's objections, he received them both. The original Mesa Grill in New York closed in September 2013 following a proposed rent increase by the landlord

recipe1.recipe_name: Grilled Skirt Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
recipe1.ingredients: 4 bone-in ribeye steaks, each about 1 inch thick, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, 2 cups fresh parsley leaves, finely chopped, 4 garlic cloves, minced, 1/4 cup finely chopped fresh oregano leaves, 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1/4 cup red wine vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes
recipe1.cooking_method: Preheat the grill to high., Season the steaks on both sides with salt and pepper, Grill the steaks for 4 to 5 minutes per side for medium-rare, Meanwhile, make the chimichurri sauce by combining the parsley, garlic, oregano, olive oil, red wine vinegar, red pepper flakes, and salt in a bowl, Serve the steaks with the chimichurri sauce on top.

recipe2.recipe_name: Burgers with Caramelized Onions and Goat Cheese
recipe2.ingredients: 2 lbs ground chuck, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, 8 slices goat cheese, 4 hamburger buns, split and toasted, 2 large onions, thinly sliced, 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 tbsp canola oil
recipe2.cooking_method: Preheat the grill to high, Divide the ground chuck into 4 equal portions and shape them into patties, Season the patties with salt and pepper, Grill the patties for 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium-rare, Meanwhile, heat the butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat, Add the onions and cook until caramelized, stirring occasionally, for about 20 to 25 minutes, Top each burger with a slice of goat cheese and caramelized onions, Serve the burgers on the toasted buns.

recipe3.recipe_name: Grilled Shrimp with Basil and Roasted Garlic
recipe3.ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil leaves, 2 tbsp chopped roasted garlic, 1 lemon, juiced
recipe3.cooking_method: Preheat the grill to high, Season the shrimp with salt and pepper, Thread the shrimp onto skewers, In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, basil, roasted garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, Grill the shrimp for 2 to 3 minutes per side until cooked through, Brush the shrimp with the basil-garlic oil and serve.

name: Chef Rachael Ray
details: Rachael Domenica Ray (born August 25, 1968) is an American cook,[1] television personality, businesswoman, and author. She hosts the syndicated daily talk and lifestyle program Rachael Ray, and the Food Network series 30 Minute Meals.[2] Other programs to her credit include Rachael Ray's Tasty Travels, $40 a Day, Rachael Ray's Week in a Day, and the reality format shows Rachael vs. Guy: Celebrity Cook-Off and Rachael Ray's Kids Cook-Off. Ray has written several cookbooks based on the 30 Minute Meals concept, and launched a magazine, Every Day with Rachael Ray, in 2006. Ray's television shows have won three Daytime Emmy Awards, Rachael Domenica Ray was born in Glens Falls, New York, the daughter of Elsa Providenza Scuderi and James Claude Ray.[3] Her mother's ancestry is Sicilian and her father is French, Scottish, and Welsh. When Ray was eight, her family moved to Lake George, New York. Her mother managed restaurants in New York's Capital District, including the Lake George Howard Johnson's restaurant, located near the former Gaslight Village amusement park, which attracted many entertainers.[5] Ray also briefly worked at Sutton's Marketplace in Queensbury, New York, and later offered to do commercials for the business.

recipe1.ingredients: 1 lb ground chicken, 1 egg, 1/2 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1/2 teaspoon salt. 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. 1 cup marinara sauce. 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
recipe1.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400°F, In a large bowl, combine ground chicken, egg, breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, garlic, salt, and black pepper, Mix well and form into 1 1/2-inch meatballs, Place meatballs on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through, Spoon marinara sauce over the meatballs and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese, Return to oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipe2.ingredients: 1 lb spaghetti, 1 lb ground beef, 1 onion, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes, 1 teaspoon dried basil, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, Salt and pepper to taste, Grated Parmesan cheese for serving
recipe2.cooking_method: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions and drain, In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium-high heat, Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent, Stir in crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper, Simmer for 15-20 minutes or until sauce is thickened, Serve sauce over spaghetti and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

recipe3.ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, 1 lb ground lamb, 1 onion, chopped, 1/2 cup uncooked quinoa, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, Salt and pepper to taste, 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
recipe3.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375°F, Cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes, In a large skillet, brown ground lamb over medium-high heat, Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, Stir in quinoa, oregano, thyme, cinnamon, salt, and pepper, Spoon lamb mixture into the bell peppers and place in a baking dish, Bake for 35-40 minutes or until peppers are tender and filling is cooked through, Sprinkle with feta cheese and serve.

name: Chef Wolfgang Puck
details: Puck was born in Sankt Veit an der Glan, Austria.[1] He learned cooking from his mother, who was a pastry chef.[2][3] He took the surname of his stepfather, Josef Puck, after his mother's remarriage.[4] The marriage produced two younger sisters and a younger brother for Wolfgang.[citation needed] He trained as an apprentice under Raymond Thuilier at L'Oustau de Baumanière in Les Baux-de-Provence, at Hôtel de Paris in Monaco, and at Maxim's Paris before moving to the United States in 1973 at age 24. After two years at La Tour in Indianapolis, Puck moved to Los Angeles to become chef and part owner of Ma Maison restaurant. Following the 1981 publication of his first cookbook, Modern French Cooking for the American Kitchen, which was based on his Ma Maison recipes, Puck opened the restaurant Spago on the Sunset Strip in 1982. Fifteen years later, in 1997, Puck and Barbara Lazaroff, his ex-wife and business partner, moved the award-winning Spago to Beverly Hills. It has been recognized as one of the Top 40 Restaurants in the U.S. since 2004. The Infatuation wrote that Spago made Wolfgang Puck the first (and maybe only) chef you and your grandma know by name.In 1991, Puck opened his fourth restaurant, Granita, a seafood restaurant in Malibu, California.[6] The restaurant closed in 2005. Since 2003, Puck's recipes have been syndicated worldwide to newspapers and websites by Tribune Content Agency.

recipe1.ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup rice, vinegar, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 tablespoon ginger, minced, 1 tablespoon garlic, minced, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1 head Napa cabbage, chopped, 1 red bell pepper, julienned, 1 cup carrots, julienned, 1 cup snow peas, trimmed, 1/2 cup sliced almonds, toasted
recipe1.cooking_method: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, honey, ginger, and garlic, Slowly whisk in vegetable oil until emulsified, Marinate chicken breasts in half of the dressing for at least 2 hours or overnight, Grill chicken until cooked through and slice into thin strips, In a large bowl, toss together cabbage, bell pepper, carrots, snow peas, and remaining dressing, Top with sliced chicken and toasted almonds, Pizza with Smoked Salmon and Caviar: This luxurious pizza combines the salty flavors

recipe2.recipe_name: smoked salmon and caviar with creamy cheese and fresh herbs
recipe2.ingredients: 1 pre-made pizza crust, 4 oz. cream cheese, softened, 2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped, 2 tablespoons fresh chives, chopped, 4 oz. smoked salmon, thinly sliced, 2 oz. caviar, 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced, 2 tablespoons capers
recipe2.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 425°F, Spread cream cheese over pizza crust, leaving a 1/2-inch border, Sprinkle dill and chives over cream cheese, Arrange smoked salmon slices over herbs, Sprinkle caviar over salmon , Top with sliced red onion and capers, Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.

recipe3.ingredients: 1 lb. spaghetti, 1/4 cup olive oil, 4 garlic cloves, minced, 1/4-1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 1 lb. shrimp, peeled and deveined, 1 lb. sea scallops, 1/2 cup white wine, 1 can (28 oz.) crushed tomatoes, Salt and pepper, 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped
recipe3.cooking_method: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions, Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, Add garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute, Add shrimp and scallops and cook until just pink, about 2-3 minutes, Remove seafood from pan and set aside, Deglaze pan with white wine and cook until reduced by half, Add crushed tomatoes and season with salt and pepper, Simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until sauce has thick

name: Chef Adam Smith
details: Birmingham-born Adam Smith fell in love with the kitchen at the tender age of 13, when he had a part-time job as a pot wash at a local restaurant. It was after that that he decided to go to catering college, where, in his words, he managed just a year before the itch to go into the industry was too strong to contain. Adam’s professional career began in 2004 at The Ritz London. At just 17 years old, he worked his way up from commis to executive sous chef over the course of 9 years. To this day, Adam cites executive chef John Williams MBE as his biggest inspiration. In both 2007 and 2009, Adam represented the UK at the Bocuse . He was also the winner of the Roux Scholarship in 2012 In 2013, Adam moved to The Devonshire Arms, Bolton Abbey as the head chef. During his time there, the restaurant was awarded four AA Rosettes and won The Yorkshire Post Hotel Restaurant of the Year award. In July 2016, it was announced that he would take on the executive chef role at Coworth Park.

recipe1.ingredients: 4 chicken breasts, 1 red bell pepper, 1 yellow bell pepper, 1 zucchini, 1 yellow squash, 1 red onion, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, salt and pepper to taste
recipe1.cooking_method: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut chicken and vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Thread onto skewers. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Brush skewers with the mixture. Grill skewers for 10-12 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

recipe2.ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, 2 cups vegetable broth, 1 red bell pepper, 1 yellow bell pepper, 1 zucchini, 1 yellow squash, 1 red onion, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 teaspoon dried basil, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, salt and pepper to taste
recipe2.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Spread onto a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle with basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Roast vegetables for 25-30 minutes or until tender. Rinse quinoa and combine with vegetable broth in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until quinoa is cooked through. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa and roasted vegetables. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipe3.ingredients: 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined, 8 corn tortillas, 1/2 cup chopped red onion, 1/2 cup chopped cilantro, 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and chopped, 1 avocado, diced, 1 lime, juiced, salt and pepper to taste
recipe3.cooking_method: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Thread shrimp onto skewers. Grill skewers for 2-3 minutes per side or until shrimp is pink and cooked through. Warm tortillas according to package instructions. In a medium bowl, combine red onion, cill
